Reviews.Title: “"Family Vacation"”
Reviews.Author: Flabound49487
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here and found it to be great for familys. It was close to Disney/Sea World, Flea Markets, & the beaches, whatever anyone wanted. We also liked the convenience to Publix and other shopping needs. We all found the place clean & updated, the staff was great and very friendly. We had read comments and where a little hesitant about staying here, would defiantly come back. There was 6 adults and 3 children and we had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: ravnjay
Reviews.Content: I took my boys on a surprise Disney/Sea World trip for my oldest's 5th birthday. We had a 2 bedroom townhouse with a loft and for the 7 of us it was amazing! Our party consisted of my family of 4, my mother, sister and her son. The bathrooms were clean, the whole apartment was amazing. The floors could use a deep clean as it would leave our feet looking dirty but it didn't FEEL dirty. There were no bugs inside the town home though there were plenty outside. We had an excellent time. The drive was a little far but it was about 25-30 minutes from Disney and 35 to Sea World. We drove out to Universal City Walk once and it was the farthest at about 45 minutes away. I'm a military wife so I'm used to traveling so the drive didn't bother me much. All in all, not a bad place. We've stayed with Wyndham resorts on numerous occasions and this is comparable with a few things different.

Reviews.Title: “Update”
Reviews.Author: jamminnjamaica
Reviews.Content: I previously wrote a review about Villas at Fortune Place and wanted to give an updated review. I had said that I had seen a bug and thought it might have possibly been bed bugs. I don't know what it was and it might have been a bed bug, however, it has been a few months now and we have no signs of bed bugs. I couldn't leave a review accusing a place of having bed bugs and it not be true. So, my review is the same and the rating is the same. I wouldn't stay here again, however, the choice is yours. Happy Traveling:)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: Kae M
Reviews.Content: Villas at Fortune Place, was the most amazing resort our family has ever been to. It was great for kids and adults..Also it was close to Disney and many other attractions. The resort was very homey, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We can hardly wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: This was an inexpensive way to stay out of the Disney craziness (20 min drive away). Walking distance to grocery store and pharmacy. Full kitchen plus washer and dryer which equals cheap meals at home as well as cheap cocktails on the patio while catching some sun. Went to Seaworld one day and few dinner shows rest of the time which were much closer and less crowded. I did escort one lizard out of the unit but I had the slider open all day while mixing drinks and getting a tan so my fault for letting him in. The unit we had was all updated and great! The front desk staff is hit or miss with attitudes BUT I think it is partly a language barrier since each one I encountered was Spanish speaking. I just brushed off any attitude afterall they are at work and i was on vacation!;)

Reviews.Title: “At least it was free!”
Reviews.Author: jamminnjamaica
Reviews.Content: If your a traveler like me, you like to read reviews and try to plan things out ahead of time. I use trip advisor a lot when traveling. However, my in-laws gave us a weeks stay here for our wedding present. So, with that we didn't have much say. I don't want to come across as unthankful because we really appreciated the fact we didn't pay anything however, if we had paid we would have been throughly disappointed. That's why I'm writing this to you. Upon entering our condo it appeared nice and clean and the only thing I noticed when unpacking our suitcases was how cheap the furniture was. That stuff doesn't matter to us. It wasn't until the next day that the shower in the master bedroom had mold in it. I'm not talking just a little mold but a lot of mold. And to go with the mold in the shower we had to shut the bathroom door at night due to the non stop faucet leak. Needless to say, the rest of my showers were taken in the guest bathroom. The second problem was the bed issue. First, it was one of the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept in. We woke up every morning with neck and back aches. Also, the headboard and bed somehow didn't fit together right and every time someone moved the bed creaked. It wasn't until the last night that has left me traumatized. While my husband was sleeping I was using a nightlight to read and noticed a bug on my nook. I squished it real quick and blood squirted out of it. Gross, I know and I'm sorry but it's the truth. I then freaked out as bed bugs came to my mind. I jumped up and started doing research on bed bugs. I looked at the mattress and couldn't see anything else, but I'm still praying that is not what it was. I know how bed bugs follow you home and how hard they are to get rid of. And now as I have read of someone else in a previous review having had bed bugs in their bed I'm really worried. In addition, they didn't ever come get our towels to clean so we had the same ones all week long. We left our trash outside our door and they were supposed to pick it up but didn't. Again, I can only tell you about the experience I had and other rooms might have been different I don't know. I did want to give you a fair opinion and if I had the ability to choose where to stay I would suggest you look somewhere else. I know it's very confusing when you are reading the reviews and some a great and some are horrible and you wonder if some are just being too picky. I always get confused when reading the reviews and you have some good and some bad. But when you are dealing with the possibility of bed bugs I wouldn't chance it. I hope this helps and that where ever you choose to stay that you have a nice enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Poo in your shower....”
Reviews.Author: Bezzadoestravel
Reviews.Content: Just come back from holiday with my two kids, wife, mum, sister, bruv in law and nephew. Not the greatest of places you can stay in Kissimmee, 30 minutes to any of the parks 45 mins to magic kingdom gates..... But it gets better... Not! On arrival my sister had to clean the villa 1300 from top top bottom, luckily the cockroaches where dead already. We had a flood from the washing machine which made the carpet in bed 3 damp and smelly. Day 3 the ants arrived think they must of been double booked by RCI as I was positive it was our weeks! Day 5 the toilet had a problem with flushing, but maintenance came and plunged it. Bit embarrassing as mum had laid some cable!! Anyway all seemed ok on day 6 but day 7 the toilet wouldn't flush again, and think my sister had dropped off while I was showering and my 2 year old and I noticed toilet paper and sewage coming back through the plug hole.. Yep I was standing ankle deep in toilet paper and sh@t. At this point reception finally moved us to villas 1339 and 1341 but that meant families were then split up which wasn't the point really. And we had to move in the dark of the night... Oh and did I mention the local architecture is the state jail (high security) pretty much slap bang opposite inclusive with razor wire.... I have tried to make this review a bit of a laugh, but honestly don't go here. I am currently seeking compensation from RCI as it wiped out a good few days of our holiday sorting out the various issues... Nice ducks though...

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't provide the comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: C M
Reviews.Content: I love the location because it's not right in the hustle and bustle of the Disney crowds. However, I can't say I'm too thrilled about the services (or lack of) provided at the resort. Yes, the resort is great at providing things like tennis courts, basketball courts, and pools. But when it comes to providing things like internet access and toilet paper and other "comforts of home", they fall short. I was told wifi access is only available at the pool - not in the rooms. So whenever I needed to use my computer (which was often because of the type of work I do for living), I had to load up my laptop equipment and walk over to the pool. I was also told once a room runs out of toilet paper, the resort does not supply anymore! So if you're planning to stay in a room with 8 people (like we did), you'd better make sure you bring your own wifi and toilet paper with you :/ Aside from all of this, depending on whom you get at the front desk, expect to deal with attitude as a couple of the staff members are somewhat rude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DJBell0406
Reviews.Content: I liked the "Old school" feel to the resort! Off the beaten path and since I did not care about Disney location was awesome! Close to everything I needed and the staff was helpful,customer friendly and willing to help with anything. No slaes people bugging me which as you know if you stay on any resort they are the most annoying people on the planet! I came with friends no kids and I loved it! Cant speak for the people who have children so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!”
Reviews.Author: margo33
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff to the groundskeepers and housekeeping folks, everyone was friendly and helpful. There were 5 of us and we stayed for 7 nights in a "sleeps 8" condo and had more than enough room - full kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 pullout couches, flat screen TV, and blessed air conditioning! The pool areas were awesome with numerous tables/chairs/lounges/umbrellas. They also have a basketball court, tennis, shuffleboard, and a putting green. The grocery store was conveniently located behind the property for food shopping, a Walgreens on the corner and other conveniences in the area as well. The Villas are located a short distance from the Disney and Universal theme parks, and major roads are easily accessible. Overall we were very impressed with the resort. and hope to stay again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Good value place”
Reviews.Author: couple20something
Reviews.Content: Good efficient check in/out. Staff helpful. The villa was all you would expect from an American apartment. Well equipped with with everything including a separate laundry room with washing machine and separate dryer. Pool towels available, the area was clean and nice to come back to after a day at the theme parks. The location was quite, close to some shops but no night life or restaurants close by. We liked the apartment and the pool, however it was a drawback having to drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok for the price....”
Reviews.Author: Belinda197 Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beware this place isn't what it should be. The master suite have a 19inch tv has a full size bed and it's a horrible bed. my room had a lizzard in it, the carpet needs to be replace really nasty so

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Sue227
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week on May as a family consisting of 3 adults and two small children. I booked a place that accomodates 8 people. The purpose of the vacation was to visit Disney, which is only about 20-25 minutes away. The accomodations were GREAT. The Master bedroom had its own bathroom with another full bath upstair, and a half bath downstairs. All the bedrooms were on the same floor which is good. The place was very clean and had all of the neccessary gadgets in the full kitchen, for those who opt to cook while on vacation. The pool area was always clean and the staff at the front desk always friendly and pleasant. I would highly recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable, just a bit off the beaten track for Seaworld/Universal”
Reviews.Author: JenniferHH Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week as a group of 5, 2 couples and 1 single in a two bedroom unit. There was ample space and privacy for all parties, although as the second couple we shared the bathroom facilities with the single user who had a bedroom which was open plan mezzanine above the main living area. Locally while there are plenty of restaurants and attractions you could drive to, there was nothing within walking distance, meaning 2 members of the party had to wear the Designated Driver hat alternative evenings. I would recommend to friends with children who plan to self cater in the evenings. If you want nightlife, look a bit closer to I4 / Idrive.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive Salesmen”
Reviews.Author: Queseyo_57
Reviews.Content: The one week stay at this place was average. What I hated the most was the pushy salesmen selling time share. They would not take "NO" for an answer. I told one of them "What part of NO don't you understand?" After saying this, the vacation was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: schumch
Reviews.Content: I wa a bit nervous after reading some of the reveiws. The villas were clean, spacious, and the pools and grounds lovely. We had 2 villas and were with a group of 10. The staff was great, pools and hot tub clean. It is a nice place to relax for the day or to unwind after a trip to the theme parks. There is a grocery and liquor store that takes about 3 minutes to walk to which was so handy. Also a Walgreens across the street. I would definitely stay there again as I know anyone in our party would. They alos have a computer at the front desk that you can use, we used it to verify flight times.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: P4Perfect
Reviews.Content: From the most friendly staff at check in to cleanliness and very well equiped 2 bedroom town house it was a great experience. There were activities for adults and kids. Impressive enterance and well maintained grounds. A very economical way to spend a week in a very expensive area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with large family..clean, comfortable and inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: grandmaw5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 10-12, 2010 for our daughter's wedding at the Royal St. Cloud Country Club/Royal Crest Room. We had a very clean townhouse unit 2/2 Loft. It had plasma tv's (2) and 1 tv in master suite. It had fully stocked kitchen, living room and a dining room. We had extended family and bridal party stay here. Each 2/2 accomodates six people. There are two pull out couch beds, Queen bed in Master Suite, and two twin beds in second floor bedroom. The place had heated pool, jacuzzi, movie rentals in the office, basketball court and a playground that our younger grandkids enjoyed to unwinde after the rehearsal. I would highly recommend this place as it is not only inexpensive, but nice to be able to have a the townhome when you have lots of family! It was perfect for our needs!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigd1974
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews a few weeks before our trip and I was worried that the Villas were no good.... My wife and I decided to atleast give it a shot and if we didn't like it we would just stay somewhere else once we got down to orlando.... My hope were very low after reading all the negative reviews... I was pleasantly surprised when got there... The place gronds were very clean and the staff were more than gracious... We checked our villa out room 1319 ( 3 Bedroom 2 bath villa ) ... It was very clean, spacious & quiet.... We had absolutly no problems with the Villas at Fortune Place... It is about a 15 - 20 min ride to Disney depending on the traffic & Construction ( They are repaviving the roads ) but it is an easy route ( Boggy Creek Rd to Osceola Parkway right into Disney.... My family and I would gladly stay here again.... I guess my mother was right when I was growing up. Don't believe everything you hear or read... There was no loud music , bedbugs or mold smell.... I am glad I kept my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,Nasty,Scary,small,broken down,in the ghetto resort”
Reviews.Author: kenosmommy
Reviews.Content: If you have a reservation here i would cancel and save your time and money.This resort is located in a bad part of town.Everything closes by 10 even on a Fri. night.Our condo stunk like mold,was filthy with something that looked like blood on the side of the frig.The microwave,spare bathroom light,ceiling fan,main bathroom sink,all broke. My son slept on the couch the one night we had to stay and was bit by something all over his body. RCI moved us the next night.I read the reviews and thought it cant be that bad,well it was worse!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: ljonesmed
Reviews.Content: The management were personable, friendly, and efficient. When we needed something fixed, ( sliding glass door in the living room) or replaced- the toaster, they were quick to respond. The sliding door was poorly installed- not placed on track correctly and so there was a breach, though small- 1/2 inches in diameter at the base of the door. They had placed insulation tape down the opening edge of the door to close the gap further up. Concerning the place itself: 1) the furniture was old and dusty- it should be replaced; 2) They had no door mats once you entered the place and since it rains often our floors were being tracked up. We ended up going to Wal-Mart to purchase an inexpensive mat. The dwelling was not compatible for young children. Our daughter is 20 months, so it would have been nice to have gates available for rent- another Wal-Mart purchase; 3) the entire downstairs was tile- no soft places for baby play;4) the upstairs became really hot although the air conditioning was working- this was because the dryer coil was simply connected to a white plastic basket to catch additional lent. There was no way for the heat to escape outside ; it simply circulated in the dwelling; finally 5) the bed was horrible, my husband had to sleep on the couch for 3 days- which we covered with clean sheets. Concerning location it was great! 20 minutes from Disney, the Florida Mall, and many other shops.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than I thought - as long as you understand the limitations”
Reviews.Author: MaestroNewJersey
Reviews.Content: The key with this hotel is knowing what you are getting. This is not a perfect place, but it has some really great features. Up to you whether the features outweigh the downsides. What's good: Room layout - our 2 bedroom suite was well laid out and large. The living room was on a separate floor from the bedrooms which was great with young kids who go to sleep early. The patio was a pleasant place for dinner. Room ammenities - nice tv, great ipod adapter, functional kitchen, bbq close to room. Pool - although each was small, there were three pools and a hottub, providing variety and the ability to keep out of the way of others when needed. Pool was a bit chilly, but still heated. Staff - the staff were very friendly and helpful What's Bad: This is not a resort. The facilities are limited, it is in a remote location, there is nothing to walk to nearby. Consider this like having a home in the suburbs of Orlando - it is a place to crash, spend a day by the pool, but if you want to see anything, you got to get into the car and drive 20 minutes. This is also not a luxury place. While the rooms are nice, don't come expecting the Four-Seasons. This is a 1980s time share and has all the quirks of staying with family. Some things are better than others. This is a good location if you want to be going to different places in the area each day but want to be home to cook your dinner. It was good value and had very good ammenities, but you will go nuts if you don't leave the property. As noted on other reviews, it is very close to the county jail. While we were in the area there was an (unsuccesful) escape attempt, and one night we heard sirens for several hours. The staff says this was very unusual. We never felt at risk on the property (security was visible and appropriate without being obtrusive), but this is not an area where you want to be taking long walks outside of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: rdempst
Reviews.Content: When we checked in everything seemed fine and nice we got a 2 bed with loft, next morning we were woke up by very loud rap music we looked outside and there was several sport bikes with engines running and then more arrived till there was 15 next thing they started to leave and they were doing burnouts and wheelies down the driveway we complained and were told they were leaving later that day phew....everything went quiet till Friday night when we were all woke up by gangs of teenagers running around the unit next door unsupervised by any adults, we again complained....the walls on these units are PAPER THIN. The workers in the complex are great though anything you needed you just had to ask and it was there in 5 minutes there wasn't enough plates and cutlery for the capacity of the unit or things like toilet paper dish washer powder etc so we often phoned house keeping for stuff but whatever you asked for it was there right away..The location was quite good with plenty of grocery stores etc its a pity they let noisy people in these places to spoil everything!! they could say keep one block of units for rowdies!!!! and its a pity they don't have internet in the units its only in reception or around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Update overdue”
Reviews.Author: banointed
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Villas at Fortune Place for a few years now. Each year we are more disappointed with the look, the extra fees, the service. It is really overdue for upgrades. my back hurt the entire week. the coach was better to sleep on. If we knew then what we know now, we would have never purchased into a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: Lisa242
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June . This resort is very clean,quiet and the service is beyond five star services.Everyone was helpful and friendly.The resort was not close to Disney or the other theme parks, but after a long day it was the perfect place to relax. They had a publix food store 2 minutes away. They had a kiddies pool,a hot tube and two other pools. I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rathar
Reviews.Content: When we booked this place, we had no idea what we were booking. It was mainly going to be a place to drop off items, go to sleep, and maybe make breakfast before heading back out to Disney. The place was better than I expected. My entire family enjoyed the place. Even after the day we came back from Animal Kingdom, we had some free time so went to the pool to just chill out. So if you are looking for a place for the family that is cheaper than a regular hotel, and if you don't mind doing your own cooking (or going out) this is a good place to stay. Only about a 20-25 minute drive from Disneyworld. I'll be coming back here in December 09.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HatDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom townhome with a loft. This unit had 2 sofa beds. One of the mattresses was stained with urine. The staff brought us another mattress the following morning. If you do not speak fluent Spanish it may be hard to communicate with most of the staff. In person, I asked for an extra towel. The man went to his golf cart and brought me an extra trash bag. The carpet in the townhome was dirty. The beds were hard. My back hurt at the end of the week. I didn't feel safe in this neighborhood with the Osceola County Jail being .03 of a mile from this location. As we were leaving, there was a helicopter with a spot light shining down in our parking lot. If you want to take your children to the pool, beware!! When we went to the pool, there was one guest there with a taser gun. If you want internet service, you can only get it by the pool unless you want to dial up from your room at a .50 charge each time you log on to the internet. The one positive thing about this place is that the staff is very friendly! However, I would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was an ok experience”
Reviews.Author: HCMatt
Reviews.Content: Place needs an update...residences seem stuck in the '80s. Front desk were very helpful and kind! No wireless internet service unless you're in the pool area, but the only time you can see your computer screen there is when the sun goes down. Not long to Disney at all...we were able to get to and from the parks within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Teddy10572
Reviews.Content: Although, after reading other mixed reviews, I wasn't expecting a four star timeshare, I was still disappointed. Now for the bad points: the carpet was disgusting , pull out sofabed appeared to be at least 20yrs old and unfit for anyone to use.,and remote control for the TV wouldn't work, That was a problem, becasue the TV had no manual buttons to use. The good points: called the front desk and the mattress was replaced the next day along with the remote. The rest of the unit, although it needed updating, was clean. The drive was about 20 min. to Disney, which we didn't mind. (We weren't traveling with small children). The place didn't seem to be in the best residential area. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you think”
Reviews.Author: caneygirl
Reviews.Content: I was like the other people who were nervous about staying here after reading the previous reviews but was pleasantly surprised. There were 9 of us staying in one of the 4 bedroom town houses with 3 bathrooms - we all had plenty of space and our privacy as well as being able to all be together. There is now another pool next to the first one and a splash pool as well. You can get free internet access in reception. All the staff were friendly and helpful. As people have said it was about 1/2 hour drive to the Disney Parks if you use the 192 but you have easy access to the Flroida Turnpike and the I4 from Fortune Place. The only thing it lacks is a bar and evening entertainment. This place is ideal if you want a quiet out of the way location - when we went we were generally the only people around the pool. I wouldn't recommend this location if you are travelling with a group who want lots to keep them occupied in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “A LONG way from Disney”
Reviews.Author: jhawktx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week. It was okay. But this place is a long long way from the Disney properties. To say it is 20 minutes away is a joke. You couldn't get there in 20 minutes even at 3:00 in the morning. It could easily take you an hour if you have bad traffic...which is typical.

Reviews.Title: “SATISFIED STAY”
Reviews.Author: mrswalker4
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with the villa's as well as the hospitality , i would greatly recommend this place to everyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Not as close to Disney as advertised - resort was okay”
Reviews.Author: Liloandstitch
Reviews.Content: Villas at Fortune Place is definitely away from all of the Disney hub-bub! We got a very good dollar rate on this resort, so for what we paid we were okay with our stay. This resort is not great, I would call it a place to hang your hat after a long day of being at the parks. The staff was polite and accommodating. Our townhome's heater kept tripping out the first two days we were there. A maintennance man was sent over to fix the problem and when it was going to take longer than planned, we were moved into a similiar townhome across the way. Our townhouse was neat and clean. It had two bedrooms and two baths (one with just a shower and the other with a tub/shower) upstairs. The master bedroom had a queen sized bed and the other room had two twin beds. One of the screens in the second bedroom window had two large tears and holes in them. I also noticed another unit with holes in the window screen. I did not think that this looked professional. The 1st level had a half bath, living room, dining room, kitchen, and breakfast nook downstairs. The living area and dining room are one open room. Because of the way the room is laid out, only one person could comfortably see the T.V. The couch was off to the side to where you could not view the T.V. well at all. We tried to turn the television set a bit so that we could all watch it, but it just didn't give very good results. A few of the other reviews and even resort advertising say that Disney World is only 20 minutes away. We tried various routes to the park over the week and we could not find one that got us there in that amount of time. Our time was anywhere from 30 to 40 minutes. With two small children it was just too far from the parks for us, especially since we went to Disney everyday. The route that we ended up using the most cost us $5.50 a day in toll fees. All in all, the distance is my biggest complaint. We spent our entire days at the parks and being 30+ minutes away was just not convenient for us. It wasn't practical to take a break in your day back at the resort because you would end up using 2+ hours in travel time getting back and forth between the resort and the parks. Since we visited in December we did not use any of the resort's outdoor amenities. If you are looking to spend a great deal of time at Disney World, I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jessd716
Reviews.Content: Our family - 11 - of us stayed in two 3-bedroom condos at the Villa. We couldn't have asked for a better location, time, etc. We had 3 children with us - 6, 5, 2 - who LOVED all the space we had. They could run around the front, back, etc. We had a very quick, easy drive to all the Disney Parks. The last day we were there, the air conditioner in one condo broke. We had someone there fixing it with in 10 minutes. Can you really get that anywhere else? During the stay, we had a 24 hr virus that made it's way through our group. The ones who got sick said it was so nice and convenient to have a Publix and Walgreens in walking distance since everyone else went to the parks. They also enjoyed having a dvd player and tons of cable stations to fill their time. The children loved being able to share the 2 - twin bed rooms and loved going to the WARM pool. All in all our group was overly satisfied. We woudl suggest anyone go stay - with or without children. The condos are very large and very convenient. We will be going back again in a couple years. The pictures that someone else provided are FAR from what the rooms look like. I didn't have the opportunity to take any pictures before the place got turned inside out by kids :-)

Reviews.Title: “comfortable base for orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: nickiTrowbridge
Reviews.Content: A well equipped and comfortable town house, spacious for 5 adults and 1 teenager. Nice decor and very clean. The accomodation is in a residential area, within walking distance of a publix supermarket.and Walgreens pharmacy. All the attractions are within a 40 minute drive. The kitchen is well equipped with an american fridge/freezer and american size oven and hob. The built in washing machine and tumble dryer is so handy if you wish to travel light. Plenty of storage space in the bedrooms, and 2 nice bathrooms. The reception staff were very friendly and would so anything to help you. There are recreational facilities but we did not use these.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after one day”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerlootoo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Villas at Fortune place after one week at Orange Lake. Well the quality between the two resorts is miles apart. Check in was easy but the girl was miserable and wore her sunglasses the whole time ... very rude I thought. Got the timeshare schpiel but completely ignored it. The unit was smelly - like it had been left a while. The unit itself was ok but in need of updating. The pool was a huge disappointment to my kids who cried when they saw it. I would describe it as a "motel" pool, not a resort. The area felt a bit rough compared to where we had stayed at Orange Lake and the jail down the road did nothing to inspire us. I assume this end of Kissimmee and the192 is the "not so smart" end. Anyway, we spent one night then booked ourselves into the disney value resort which the kids were thrilled with. I would not go back to Villas at Fortune place and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: addison4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Disney staying at Villas At Fortune Place. This is an older property, carpets needed cleaning and bathroom needed update. But overall it is a large condo with room for everyone, and on a quite backstreet. Staff was friendly and very quick to answer problems. (The gas grill would not lite) They were there in 5 minutes after I called. Disney is only 20 minutes away if you take the turnpike and pay the toll. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Okace”
Reviews.Author: embrydl
Reviews.Content: This was a nice property. However, I was a little surprised when I turned onto Simpson Rd., on my way to the resort for the first time, to discover that the Osceola County Jail is about 1.5 miles up the road. Check- in was fairly smooth. The only part I did not like was that I had to go to "guest services" before I could get a parking pass. "Guest Services" is located in one of the villas. When you ring the doorbell, you will be let in by a very pretty young lady. From the way she was talking, she is some kind of model (and she really looks the part). Before she will give you a parking pass, she has to try to get you to go to a timeshare presentation. She told me that I only had to go to breakfast and fill out a survey with no 90 min. presentation required. My "survey" took 4hrs. We were sent to Vacation Village at Parkplace. The property was very nice, and the breakfast was at a cuban restaurant on the campus of Disney Celebration. All of this took much more than 90mins., we were there for more than 4 hours. enduring the high pressure sales tactics. However, my wife and I held our ground and refused to purchase. We never did get to take the survey. All in all we had an enjoyable experiance at Vills of Fortune Place, but if you're not careful, you will leave Florida $30,000 more in timeshare debt than when you arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Nice seclusion from all the theme park chaois.”
Reviews.Author: gsaldana
Reviews.Content: We just returned from traveling to Orlando, Florida. I stayed in the 2 bedroom loft with 7 people (accomodates 8). I was plesantly surprised with all the room we had. It was a townhouse with a bedroom and loft area upstairs. The loft area looked like a den area ( tv and sofa/bed), perfect for my daughters boyfriend who traveled with my husband and I and our 4 children. The bathrooms were rather small, but master bedroom was roomy. I also had a full kitchen and small patio area. It rained almost the whole week we were there but, it would last no more than an hour or two. Theme parks are about 20-30 minutes away. My children, ages 13, 16, 19 & 23, liked the mini townhome because it had all the comforts of home and we did not step in each others space, like we would of in a 2 room connecting at a regular hotel. I recommed this place for larger families. My sister, her husband, son and my mom and dad shared a 2 bedroom room and it was quite smaller and not as roomy.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: VicMur
Reviews.Content: The property was very nice. The master bedroom was roomy. The other bedrooms were small and had only a night stand in them. The two people staying in each of those rooms had to live out of their suitcases for the week. Here's the fun part: Here in 2007 they don't have internet service to the rooms. I called and they said that they have wireless service by the pool. Which, since it rained daily that week might have been a little detrimental to my laptop. In one of the bedrooms one of the bifold doors to the closet was broken and an outlet was broken. The location was easy to get to from the Florida Turnpike. I found out that it is known as the safest location in Kissimmee. Maybe since it's located by the Sheriff's Dep't and the County Jail. Travel to all attractions were very easy. Maximum time was 20 - 30 minutes. If you just want someplace to shower and sleep. It's great. I won't be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Surcharge”
Reviews.Author: wgn
Reviews.Content: The place is nice and has roomy (but on two stories) units. It is off the beaten path from the resorts. My only complaint was although I had prepaid Traveloctiy for room, taxes and fees, they made me pay an additional "Resort Fee" before they would give me my keys. Not a large amount but still "dirty pool"

Reviews.Title: “To far away”
Reviews.Author: pkday
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this condo in Florida. The condo itself was fine, however the location is a good 40 mins from the park not 20. After a long day at the parks the last thing we wanted to do was get in the car and drive for almost 40 mins. The staff was nice and the condo was pretty clean. The bathrooms were a little small. There is really NOTHING but a grocery store and a few fast food resturants around the immeidate location. Nice if you want to be around a bunch of residential homes but not good for a vacation to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: villareview
Reviews.Content: We had (2) units here for a family reunion over Christmas. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms and friendly staff. Both units were little "houses" with full kitchens, living rooms and dining rooms, along with plenty of sleeping rooms and roomy closets. We had plenty of room to cook and serve meals which saved lots of money over going out to eat with so many people. It did take a while to get to Disney World from here, but that was the only inconvenience for us and was just one day out of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Fair place, not exactly what I call a resort”
Reviews.Author: swillyone
Reviews.Content: This is an ok place to stay. Pros: 1)Roomy. We stayed in a three bedroom townhouse. 2)Quiet. There were not a lot of tenants there and it was not in the main busy area of Kissimmee. There is still quick access to 192. 3)Courteous staff. 4)Nice grounds. Cons: 1)Needs some updates as far as decor and how well the rooms are maintained. 2)There is a county jail within walking distance of the resort. 3)The staff, although courteous, did not seem to want to make any basic decisions without the managers permission. For example, I needed to print out our boarding passes. This is crucial to do 24 hours ahead of time if you fly Southwest. The one computer that guests were allowed to use did not have printer access. I asked if the front desk could do it for me and she said I would have to wait until the next day because she needed to talk to the manager first. Very sad. Other basic requests typically were the same "I have to ask my manager". 4)Very little on-site entertainment. There was a barbeque one day and ice cream on another. 5) Poor gym equipment. The gym had 3 pieces of equipment in a small room, the basketballs were severly worn, boring playground, and the pool had few flotation devices. Overall: Last year I stayed at their brother resort at Parkway. Parkway was great, it is a typical resort standard. In previous years I have stayed at Orange Lake, The Palms, and Sunterra/Polynesian Isles. These I would also consider to be nice resorts. The Villas is a poor standard for a resort. They should invest more money into the property and teach their employees how to make decisions without the manager's permission.

HotelInfo.Name: Villas at Fortune Place
HotelInfo.Address: 1201 Simpson Road, Kissimmee, FL 34744
